intro: Bornmuellera kiyakii, commonly known as the Kiyakii mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the rainforests of Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clustered inflorescences. The plant relies on host trees for water and nutrients, while photosynthesis occurs through its own foliage. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
